symptoms.name: Erythema nodosum
symptoms.pattern: May appear days after initial symptoms

physical_findings: Flat, soft abdomen with normal bowel peristalsis
Mild tenderness from the right side of the abdomen to the umbilical region
Multiple tender infiltrative erythematous plaques on the extensor surfaces of both lower legs

imaging_findings.CT: Wall thickening of the ileocecal area and swelling of the surrounding lymph nodes
imaging_findings.Colonoscopy: Aphthous-like ulcers and erosions scattered from the distal end of the ileum to the cecum and ascending colon; round ulcers

required: Positive culture of Yersinia enterocolitica from intestinal fluid or biopsy (cold culture may be necessary)
Characteristic colonoscopy and computed tomography findings (wall thickening of the ileocecal area, swollen lymph nodes, aphthous ulcers and erosions)
supportive: Symptoms of abdominal pain, diarrhea, and fever
Pathological findings of lymphocyte aggregates in the mucosal to submucosal layers (no granuloma formation)
